arm_group.description: Males and females with alopecia scheduled for general anaesthesia.

brief_summary.textblock:
This is a prospective, observational study, aimed  to establish  changes  of bispectral
      bilateral system in both cerebral hemispheres during  a total intravenous anaesthesia during
      breast surgery in the woman. By placing two Bispectral bilateral sensors (BIS), one on both
      frontal lobes, and another on both parietal lobes, we wanted to evaluate differences between
      frontal and parietal areas, when the patient is awake and during the anaesthetic procedure.

clinical_study.brief_title: Monitoring of Anaesthesic Depth in the Cerebral Cortex Using Bispectral Bilateral System.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  Aged more than 18 years old.

          -  Scheduled for general anaesthesia.

          -  Agree to participate(signed inform consent).

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  Neurological disease.

          -  Cognitive impairment.

          -  Egg allergy.

          -  Severe disease or condition that could potentially interfere with interpretation of
             tests.

study_pop.textblock: Patients with alopecia scheduled for general anaesthesia.

clinical_study.official_title: Monitoring of Anaesthetic Depth at Different Locations in the Cerebral Cortex Using Bispectral Bilateral System

oversight_info.authority: Spain: Comité Ético de Investigación Clínica

primary_outcome.measure: Bilateral BIS values from frontal and parietal areas.
primary_outcome.time_frame: Bilateral BIS values will be taken at baseline, anaesthetic induction, endotracheal intubation, skin incision, mantenance of anaesthesia and in emergence from anaesthesia ( 3 hours as a maximum from baseline to emergence).

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

secondary_outcome.measure: EEG changes at LOC (loss of consciousness) and ROC (recovery of consciousness).
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Changes will be evaluated at induction and emergence.

clinical_study.study_design: Observational Model: Cohort, Time Perspective: Prospective
